website_summaries.verdict: A responsive gaming motherboard that is suitable for avid gamers, but it, comes with some concerns including a high possibility of BIOS issues.
pros: A comprehensive board that is compatible with Intel 8th and 9th Gen processors, which support most modern games
Has ample memory space, which keeps action from becoming sluggish
cons: BIOS is likely to need updating, but it may still not perform as expected
Tends to freeze up, possibly due to sensitive ports resulting in loose connectivity

customer_reviews.title: 9700k at 5.1 ghz and 79 C
customer_reviews.text: running a i7-9700k at 5.1 with XMP (corsair h110i and kyronaut thermal paste), the max core temp recorded was 79 C during cinebrench and cpu mark. cpu mark score of 20352 cinebench r15 score of 1631 (stock got 1472) Also getting 2 Mb/s more on WiFi download speeds with 50 Mb/s connection speed by using the on board antenna. Not sure what that's all about but it was a nice surprise. if you want to get into the real technical details of this board watch buildzoid's videos on youtube. all in all, gigabyte has the best VRM of the generation of boards, and the worst bios (not a big deal).
customer_reviews.author: M.G. Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Hardware, BIOS sucks
customer_reviews.text: The board ittsself is great, better than anything else at the same price range. But the bios even with the update is a pain to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at getting an Asus maximus for my 9700k. I looked through so many reviews and found this board to be the best of what I wanted. I get a solid overclock of 5.1ghz with no issues with the VRMs as people have had with the maximus boards. Ive moved this board from an NZXT h500i to an H700i, and nothing broke, nothing bent, its all good.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Vier

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the i9-9900k. The board has a lot of m.2 and fan ports, which is nice. The BIOS design is kind of a nightmare, all I have done in it so far is set XMP profile. The software apps are okay, but I don't like how you can't set which temperature to reference in the Smart Fan app, and the CPU temperature shows 8-10 C lower than what other monitors read.
customer_reviews.author: Haunty

customer_reviews.title: Works great with 9900K
customer_reviews.text: I started with an ASUS MAX Hero, unfortunately I got a bad processor which was the real trouble, but the ASUS had other random issues. After a few days of frustration I decided to try this and it was able to get the bad processor to boot faster and without rewriting the C drive, I was very impressed by that. Have since straightened the the whole thing out and am very pleased with the performance of the MB. Not even considering that it's cheaper than it's ASUS equivalent, I am very happy with the board. 4.8g all 8 cores and 5.3g on one with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Desfosses

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Get RAM Running at XMP Speed
customer_reviews.text: Set up and install went well. With 2x8GB Patriot Viper Steel Series DDR4-4133 MHz ram (not on QVL list) I could not get ram to work at either XMP speed. After some research, which indicated that the t-topology board clocked ram better with all slots filled (4 sticks of ram), I bought another identical 2x8GB set of ram. The computer posted immediately at the profile 2 speed (4000MHz) and is gaming (so far) stable. I didn't try profile 1 (4133 MHz). I'm very satisfied with the MB to date. If you want 16GB of ram, which is all that's needed for gaming, I recommend you go with 4X4GB with this MB.
customer_reviews.author: Rich M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for anyone
customer_reviews.text: I installed this MB about 6 weeks ago, and have been running it 24/7 since. It arrived on time, well packaged, and with great easy to install instructions. I haven't played it for gaming, so I do not have any review on what that is like, of course it is rated to be one of the best for gaming. But I wasn't going to pop out another 500 for a video card just yet, when I do not play games. What I do love is that I put an M.2 SSD to run as my primary drive, and it found it immediately, and the OS install was flawless. Thank you for a great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shon R Scott

customer_reviews.title: 3 M.2 slots. Tons of USB
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because it's the only one I could find with 3 M.2 slots. I can't do gaming anymore without the super-fast SSDs. It's also the only MB I found with this many USB ports. The only drawback I've found so far is that the included documentation only shows how to overclock for i9 processors and it sort of implies that overclocking with i7s is not going to work out. It's doesn't EXPLICITLY say that, but the fact that the instructions are specifically for i9s, gives me cause for concern. I also had a hard time finding anything online for OCing anything other than i9 with this MB.
customer_reviews.author: jgreene777

customer_reviews.title: be very careful with the m2 slots
customer_reviews.text: after installing m2, and tightening the screw, the slot feels loose. Not certain I tighten it a little bit more and the thin screw snapped. Ends up slot 1 and 2 does not lock down tightly, only slot 3 feels secured, and the cheap screw snapped so now I can only use slot 2 and 3.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M Wong

customer_reviews.title: fantastic board but one stupid flaw
customer_reviews.text: this board has everything you could want in a board EXCEPT the fusion 2.0 software is sooo bad it was almost a deal breaker for me the settings in the software are so limited plus the choices are terrible i just decided to leave it on default goes through each color its a shame the board itself is awesome just that stupid software hope they fix it in the future
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Soto

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough good about this
customer_reviews.text: After many trials and trepidations with the last mobo, which didn't work with the i9-9900 cpu, I bought this one. Easy and quick to install Documentation was far better Fit my full size case much better than the last mobo 4 slots for memory 3 slots for m.2 ssd Plenty of expansion slots Plenty of fan connectors The bios was easy to use, except for one thing. I wanted to RAID 1 my first two m.2 drives and that was impossible without knowledge from a most excellent YouTube video taking me step-by-step through the process.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Love this board
customer_reviews.text: Without going in too much on the bios, which is not very great, but it does work and can be setup if you research a bit. The board does extremely well, the Vram is just adds the boost to the 99k cpu and brings me the power I need. The only drawback, and it may be updated by now, is that I do not get to use the full 4400 MHz of my ram, for some reason the board will not allow me to set this. Bios update was suppose to fix it, I have not updated in a while though. Other than that, the board out performs anything else I have even with being limited on my ram speed.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Bright

customer_reviews.title: Best motherboard yet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great motherboard. Fast boot up without the extra settings, i have a core i 5 9600k not over clocked and it still boots fast. Im a computer builder/gamer i have built 14 computers since 2003. i have two invida gtx 970;s in sli. on this build. powered by corsair rm750x. cooling is corsair h100 from 2014.
customer_reviews.author: tdemp3

customer_reviews.title: Buggy
customer_reviews.text: This was my first build in about 10 years and I was looking for the best. This MB has some serious features with lot's of M.2 bays and quality components. However for me it's been very buggy. The internal HDMI port is very senstive and just moving the cable can cause the whole system to freeze. I'm a day trader and have 6 monitors. A freeze during a trade would be a very bad event for me. Make sure to use an external video-card if possible. On the first startup the motherboard would power up and then power down multiple times before starting up fully leaving me pretty worried. After getting past those issues, it's a pretty solid motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Good mobo.
customer_reviews.text: Optane is a PITA to setup, could be documented better. I didn't notice the thermistors until after I closed up the case. It would be good if they put just a little more effort into the documentation. Oh, and the software on the CD is crap, but that's typical. But really good, and the RGB features are very very nice. I've got a OC'd i9-9900k, and have the RGB setup to fluxuate with temp, so I can always see if I have issues. It's fast, stable, easy to build, and very full featured. And I love the BIOS - clean and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J. Peters

customer_reviews.title: I dont recommend it. Not even with the warranty
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this motherboard broke within three months of having it. One day my computer just shut off on it's own and wouldn't come back on. I sent it off to gigabyte because I bought the warranty and I thought I would be good. Their customer service is abysmal, it took weeks to get a response, and when I did get one, they told me the warranty didnt cover it. They said it would be $100 to fix it and I just decided based on the customer service experience alone, it wasnt worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Thebogal

customer_reviews.title: Received first board DOA
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully amazon is cross-shipping me a new one. Will revise review if this new one works. Set it up with 1 stick of RAM, cpu only, would power on for a second then shut off. 4th gigabyte board in 4 different generations, first one that came DOA, hopefully this isn't their new quality I should expect. ****UPDATE******* 2nd board showed up and worked. Rock solid stable at 5ghz with an i7-9700k ddr4-3200 (g.skill), ran prime 95 for 8 hours to break in the system, even overclocked. first board must have been an outlier, hopefully this one lasts years like the others have.
customer_reviews.author: N. Binder

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard for Intel i9 desktop build
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my first desktop build. I have an i9 with RTX2070 super, Fractal Meshify S2 case, 32gb ram. The motherboard offers all the features I needed. I know that others have stated that the bios is not intuitive. I am not really seeing the issue and I have had not problems making changes in the bios. Great motherboard and I would highly recommend for a desktop build. Instructions were very good and well laid out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H

customer_reviews.title: First Gigabyte Motherboard and very pleased
customer_reviews.text: My first build not using an Asus motherboard and I was nervous. This easily clocked my i5 9600k at 5.2ghz all cores at 1.34v, amazing! Bundled with seasonic prime ultra platinum PSU high quality juice and extremely stable overclocks. Biggest complaint one dead fan header in less than 6 months but not worth the time to send in. Thankfully there are many backup fan headers.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Great boards, basically a master without backplate and finned vrm heatsink.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you cant beat it, I wanted to upgrade my board so I figured try to renewed and save 100. I got it in and tested it but it didnt work for me. I couldnt get a post at all, more than likely it was a bios issue. I did send it back for a refund and I managed to get a new one and flashed its bios with no issue. This board runs great and has awesome overclock capabilities. Ive had 2 of them and both were great baords.
customer_reviews.author: The Foreman's

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful board! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: So far no issues. I installed this upon recieving. I originally had a standard ASRock board. I was sceptical that it would work right out of the box but boy was I wrong. I hooked it up and it posted no issues. The board itself looks amazing. The only issue I had was getting the software from the site to download but once I did it works like a charm. Would but again.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Overclocks 9900K better than my old boards
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, does what it's supposed to. It seems easier to get stable overclocks out of my 9900k than with my previous MSI motherboard, and my AsRock. but those boards also cost $100 or more less. The armored pcie slots and ddr4 slots seem very sturdy. for once I didn't cringe as I installed my ram haha I think it's an awesome board, and recommend it if you need the features.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: High quality, good value.  Beats ASUS for i9-9900k.
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research, I found that the higher end Aorus z390 boards far outperformed the available ASUS z390 boards with respect to power regulation. The ASUS boards were having major problems feeding enough power to the i9-9900k for over locking. I was happy spending less on this board for higher performance. It also has RGB if you are into that. I installed RGB memory and it has no problem controlling it. I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Snodgrass McFluffinstuff

customer_reviews.title: Hardware is excellent. Software, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Great VRMs and even has three M.2 heat spreaders. For some reason though I couldn't install Windows on my Samsung 970 Evo no matter which UEFI settings I used. Had some random freezing issues when waking my system from sleep. Compared to the MSI MEG Z390 Ace that I ended up getting instead, I could install Windows on my 970 Evo with enabling just one UEFI setting and no freeze issues even after a month. I still think Gigabyte's hardware is excellent, but the UEFI issues and even their horrible RGB Fusion software (which breaks all of my other lighting) will make me steer clear of Gigabyte.
customer_reviews.author: Alan T Chung

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Built in wifi and bluetooth, along with a bluetooth and wifi antenna - RGB lighting on the board, along with plenty of DLED and LED pins - IO shield looks nice, as does the M2 heatsink Cons: - BIOS is a pain to work with - Gigabyte's RGB software, RGB Fusion 2.0, isn't great, but works good enough
customer_reviews.author: Adam Whisnant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I helped my son build a new computer using this motherboard. It's well built with a lot of features like built in wireless, usb 3.1, and USB C. Works great. I have an older gigabyte motherboard and having been happy with this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P

customer_reviews.title: 9th gen i7 issue with bios - FYI
customer_reviews.text: Bios ver F6 came with this mobo. Spent the last two hours trying to get windows 10 installed from USB, also bought new with this order. After choosing 64 or 32 bit version the screen would freeze. Bios version F7 contains support for generation 9 intel processors. After flashing the bios to F7, as I'm typing this win 10 has just finished installing.
customer_reviews.author: Riven

customer_reviews.title: Ugly but well built and stable for OCed BIM workstation
customer_reviews.text: Rather Gigabyte simplify and dump the excessive packaging to knock a few dollars. Its quite pricey and aesthetics looks like its designed for Manga crazed 10 year olds. Bought it for the 6 layer PCB and impressive power delivery/cooling. Has it running on i9-9900k, works well with mid-budget build to do BIM production workflow and renderings. Its boringly stable running all cores @ 5.0 with a NZXT water cooler during renders.
customer_reviews.author: Kee H Song

customer_reviews.title: Just great - Power delivery is super!
customer_reviews.text: This board is great. The power delivery is second to none and the bios is fine. The bios lets you do anything that's needed to overclock your computer. Not sure why people complain about the bios! I'm running the same cpu and graphics card and mt computer is faster. Buy this board it's super... Great job Gigabyte. I'm Very Happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best z390 mobo that ive used so far and im on #6!
customer_reviews.text: Great VRM's and i mean really good even manages to keep my 9900k bout 7-9 degrees cooler not sure how but think its the OUTSTANDING power phase on this badboy! Took my 32gb (8x4) ddr4 3200 no problem! RGB headers galore as well as a ton of fan headers this is just a great board period! Thanks Gigabyte now i can start saving for that 2080ti!
customer_reviews.author: R.Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Well built motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been an ASUS and ASROCK guy, this was my first time using a gigbyte board and I am not disappointed. The UIBios could have been a little more user friendly, but it was still a 4/5 experience. Great board. Been running solid for 3 months so I'm pretty sure this thing will last me years.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: If you have ever owned a Asus ROG motherboard you will be disappointed with this board
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this board! It wouldn’t run my Corsair CORSAIR Dominator Platinum SDRAM DDR4 3000 CMD16GX4M2B3000C15 XMP. Would reboot and set memory to default. It had pauses when you launch certain apps or games. Coming from a Asus Maximus Hero X. I used this board for 3 days and I am returning it. The bios seems limited. It looked nice in the case. Nice lighting on the board.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: First Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: Like title says it’s my first born. Building with this motherboard was a lil challenging since it’s my first but it was well worth at the end. Comes with everything you need and more. WiFi anttenna came with it. Works fine without one if you’re close, but love how much 10x better it gets with one. Also came with stickers if you like those. Didn’t put them on mine. Bios was was great with being able to monitor your system fan and change the speed. Your able to control any lighting on fans, rams and motherboard. Pretty great.
customer_reviews.author: Zak Li

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Device was awesome for two months, then it started having issues recognizing memory modules. This device was not overclocked. I sent it in for an RMA, I received 6 weeks later non-functioning. Gigabyte has completely ghosted me on support for the motherboard. I recently filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau. Gigabytes rating is an F by the way. I urge you to select a different manufacture for your motherboards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice but.... BIOS sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Pros : nice board for overclocking and everday use. Cons : BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS BIOS
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Only bas thing is that the screws they give you for m2 heat sink seemed cheap. Basically one of the two seemed defective and so the screw snapped and I couldn’t remove it because it was near flush. It is possible i over torqued but the other one wasn’t. I wasn’t going to rma because the board functionally works without the heat sink and i was excited to play games
customer_reviews.author: J. Viveiros

customer_reviews.title: God-like Mobo
customer_reviews.text: The mobo is great, it has practically everything you would want and more. The instructions were very clear, the board was in perfect condition, the packaging was decent, and I had zero issues when I built it and turned it on for the first time. People hate on its BIOS, I don't see why. It works and navigation is simple.
customer_reviews.author: Ryker

customer_reviews.title: Literally the only part of a $2k+ build I dont have.
customer_reviews.text: No idea Amazon Lost or Oversold it so I got about $2k in pc parts that can do nothing. I pay for prime but if it doesn't work its not worth it. Probably moving to Newegg for stuff like this. Walmart got my deliverable groceries already Bezos wont miss me and amazon can rip off others with their constantly shifting prices.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Buck

customer_reviews.title: High Performance but....
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Z390 that I have purchased. It is a powerful board but it meant for knowledgeable overclockers. It is up to the user to exercise proper care that components have adequate cooling so that they do not overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Psi Star

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Product
customer_reviews.text: I have used Gygabyte motherboards for years. I never had a problem. This one had boot issues. It would boot but not complete the boot and restart. If it did finally start the OS it would eventually lock up.
customer_reviews.author: Lightmanrt

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Room and Customizability
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was surprisingly easy to install but it was really nice with how easy it was to install everything onto it, it is a durable motherboard, no pins were broken, and it's performance is great so far, really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Akyildiz

customer_reviews.title: 5ghz? No problem.
customer_reviews.text: This mobo is EXCELLENT. I previously had a Maximus Hero X and it stopped overclocking properly so I bought this to replace it. Runs Flight Sim flawlessly even with real world traffic and weather on. Overclocks to 5ghz with ease. Temps hover around 40-50c at FULL LOAD. Im using an AIO, but regardless this thing is absolutely amazing. Perfect mid range board. If you are weighing this one versus the Pro, pay the extra $50 and buy it. You wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: spotieotie

customer_reviews.title: Great looks, layout, manual. Decent WiFi.
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say I was originally going with the asrock Taichi but I’m so glad I got this instead. Looks fantastic with the lighting and sleek aesthetic - I also have the aorus 2080 so they match nicely. Easy to follow manual and quick set up and good placement for all headers and sata ports made this a 5 star no brainer for me. Oh also, the WiFi has been pretty good so far. I definitely go wired if you can but if you don’t have a choice the Wifi adapter works just fine for online gaming needs so long as your internet connection is reasonably decent.
customer_reviews.author: Evan M

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I am using 4 of these motherboards. 1 is on my graphics and video manipulation computer. 1 is on my video server. 1 is used for a high end gaming system and one is on my business system used for business and internet
customer_reviews.author: Jack Jianshe

customer_reviews.title: DOA PUrchased Used item
customer_reviews.text: D.O.A. After replacements. I ended up with a working version. but this specifically gets a 0 star because it arrived damaged ( Purchased USed. )
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Walthour

customer_reviews.title: Ezpz and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: One of the top mobos. Can rely on gigabyte to make some epic motherboards. Bios is simple and easy yet still has the options to be advanced if needed. I am not highly knowledgeable about over clocking yet this mobo was stupid easy to work with to oc my i9 and b-die ddr4 . Ezpz
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Solid board but...
customer_reviews.text: Great board, does its job and has more supported features than I will ever need. Using with an Intel i9 9900KS and MSI 2070 Super. The onboard WiFi/Bluetooth is weak.... until you plug in the antenna. Don't forget to do that. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived factory Defected bios problem
customer_reviews.text: I’v been use gigabyte 15 years, but recently gigabyte have arrived with issues and the bios its too complicated I’m presure the quality control in the factory they are not good
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Must buy! For i9 9900k
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a Z390p (horrible motherboard for a i9 not sure why I even had it at first) best choice ever! i9 9900k @ 5GHZ doesn’t even reach over 80c under any stress test, the VRM’s are amazing and I was surprised that it was delivered with the current bios
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Received a Dead Motherboard on arrival with no  mounting screws (waiting for replacement)
customer_reviews.text: Received a Dead Motherboard on arrival with no mounting screws Received second DEAD MOTHERBOARD on arrival. This is their last chance on the 3RD board! I will update when I receive the 3rd replacement board.
customer_reviews.author: Justin P

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control Issues
customer_reviews.text: Freezes when installing Windows. Seems to be an issue with the ram. I have two sticks at 8Gb 3200 MHz. I tried every possible config. It always senses 2400 and crashes when I try to boot off Windows thumb drive to install OS. I will be going with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Boot Loop
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box I was stuck in a boot loop. This happened with a previous Gigabyte motherboard, when I switched memory, so I knew this time to make sure memory, NVMe, etc. were all on Gigabyte's compatibility list. When trying to contact Gigabyte's support, I had not received a response within 2 days, so I returned the motherboard for an ASRock that did work.
customer_reviews.author: MP Combat Cop

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic board.
customer_reviews.text: Great board A+ I did have to update the bios via a flash drive before I could get it to boot to the windows install with a 9700k, otherwise it would just freeze during install. Worked like a charm after the bios update. Have had it running with a 9700k at 5.0 ghz all cores at 1.32 volts with a Dark Rock Pro 4 for about 2 months now and have not had a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly righ out of the box
customer_reviews.text: We use it for business use and video compilation. Setup the settings in the BIOS for our needs. Very easy and straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Athena Pantekoek

customer_reviews.title: Great all around MoBo
customer_reviews.text: The IO is pretty good, could had used a couple more USB ports though, can never have too many of those these days. Gigabyte needs to get their Bios sorted out though, still one of the worst Bios's out there, well behind MSI.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Wobbles

customer_reviews.title: Great Board
customer_reviews.text: I like this motherboard and the 3x M.2 slots w/the covers to minimize heat transfer from cards to the M.2 slots.
customer_reviews.author: Vonmahr

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming and overclocking
customer_reviews.text: The board was really simple and solid. . It has lots of features for the price point. found the BIOS easy to use and the Gigabyte BIOS flash utility is particularly handy - it is Windows based and finds, downloads, and flashes the BIOS updates without the need to load the update on a flash drive which is great for a custom build
customer_reviews.author: Moony Mars

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard that takes advantage of all the new tech
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading to a motherboard that could run M.2 was a major concern for me. This one runs M.2 in Raid 0 ! It supports all the new tech that I want to include in my new build. Great work Gigabyte! And thank you Amazon for the quick delivery time !
customer_reviews.author: Pam M.

customer_reviews.title: Seemed worth it
customer_reviews.text: I put this motherboard in a friends computer with an I9-9900K processor. They perform really well together.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Cox

customer_reviews.title: RGB software sucks, the specs are good.
customer_reviews.text: I like the price of this motherboard a lot. You get a lot of bang for your buck, BUT the RGB software is really bad and won't sync the mobo with the RAM cards so that's a bit of a disappointment. It is really buggy and stressful to deal with at times when I just want it to work as intended. Please for the love of god make a new or update your software
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Folk

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY from this product
customer_reviews.text: Great reviews on YouTube! Sure. DO NOT BUY! Just do a search for Realtek Driver problems on Gigabyte Z390 boards. Unbelievable how messed up this is.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This has been an excellent motherboard combined with i7-9700k. The manual was thorough and detailed. After installation, everything worked on first boot, with all 4 sticks of RAM detected and available. The BIOS is relatively easy to navigate and Easy Mode shows the most important information. Windows 10 Pro installed without problems.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Great overall product
customer_reviews.text: I love the design and easy of use of this product. The BIOS also has an expansive array of customization and options, including an easy mode for those who want to keep it simple. The aesthetics of the device also look very nice with easy access to the RGB lighting from the desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Rouie

customer_reviews.title: Great looking mother board
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mother board. The rgb lights are very cool and there’s plenty of slots for everything you could possibly want to install.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brielmaier

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome and performs
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my i9 9900k, 2080ti and multiple m.2 ssds. Like all the features and thermal guards.
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma28

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming MB
customer_reviews.text: Love this motherboard. Bios has great overclocking. M.2 ports are perfectly positioned not to interfere. Great gaming board.
customer_reviews.author: Thompson

customer_reviews.title: First time builder and couldn’t be happier!!
customer_reviews.text: Works absolutely great!! I did lots of research before finally settling on this motherboard, and I don’t regret it one bit! This thing is a beast for the money and looks stunning too!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Dady

customer_reviews.title: Received a non working board, costed $40 to send in, and $100 to fix
customer_reviews.text: I recieved my board and had to ship it back in due to it not working. Sent the board in which costed $40 on my behalf, sent the email to the wrong email address and then finally got an email back saying with pictures of a damaged cpu port, which was damaged on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Pickle Chin

customer_reviews.title: Impressive looks
customer_reviews.text: Very good looking board. Probably the best positioned headers I’ve seen on a board before. Gigabyte’s BIOS is still garbage but that’ll never change LOL. At least they have a super reliable board.
customer_reviews.author: hoekstra1

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I went through three of these boards in trying to build a custom computer. The first had faulty memory slots, the second had bent pins and the third had an unstable BIOS (even after updating). So frustrating, especially since I had had a good experience with the same model board last year. I would suggest approaching this board with caution.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly fast and stable board for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I do wish it had a few more drive slots and USB 3.0 connections, but otherwise a very feature rich board.
customer_reviews.author: DanTana

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: 2 dead on arrival. It was a mistake trying out Gigabyte. Went back to Asus and haven’t had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: B V

customer_reviews.title: I could not beat the performance or price!
customer_reviews.text: This was a product that I was unsure about buying, but so glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Broeke

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Good protective packaging. This is a really nice motherboard. Works as advertised. This is a good trusted brand I will be making another build soon and will probably buy this board again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Near Perfect Board
customer_reviews.text: Solid quality, decent enough instructions, and has all the features you could ask for. RGB is subtle which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard DOA
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard came DOA. I can't even get to a BIOS screen. Error code 78 which some users are reporting has somthing to do with not detecting a video card or monitor. Tried 2 known good cards and monitors to no avail. Intel I7-9700KF
customer_reviews.author: Aidan Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: overall its perfect, only that one of the onboard RGB is not working but its not even noticeable. I would definitely recommend this for routine users as well as gamers.
customer_reviews.author: vivian oliver graham

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: i dont have any issues everything fit and went well. well close into a month of having it and all systems are good to go still.
customer_reviews.author: mike luna

customer_reviews.title: For what i know - good mobo for the money
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt able to check, item was delivered in damaged box so I sent it back right away not taking my chances
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Zhukovskiy

customer_reviews.title: Great mobo
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze even if this was my first build. So far everything works great. I'll come back to update if anything changes
customer_reviews.author: Ben Wells

customer_reviews.title: Nice motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great motherboard easy to install and has a really nice interface.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn McGaugh

customer_reviews.title: Very capable motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: It seems as though the manufacturer, Gigabyte, thought of everything on this motherboard. Anything I could ever want on a PC is on this motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Trautman

customer_reviews.title: BIOS is still meh
customer_reviews.text: Far better than before but still has bugs and isn't super end-user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Stratton McCrary

customer_reviews.title: Very premium MOBO
customer_reviews.text: This things looks very premium and it's a workhorse. Have not turned my PC Off since I've built it and it feels like day 1.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gaming mb for value!
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard came highly recommended. I am thankful I took the advice. Great motherboard for gaming. Only down side is that I had to update my cooling system. Going with and I9 and this mb my old cooling system did not have a bracket that fit.
customer_reviews.author: Richard White

customer_reviews.title: Solid motherboard for gaming computer
customer_reviews.text: Paired this motherboard with an Intel I9-9900K, 500GB Samsung 970 Pro ssd, and an EVGA GTX 2080 graphics card. Using this to power virtual reality in an Oculus Rift. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: musicbob

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the new i9. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Andre G

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. Still tons of slots for expansion even after building my pc.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Willard

customer_reviews.title: Great Board for Gaming
customer_reviews.text: This is my first high end gaming was build. arrived on time. good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Zaharan K.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Pretty dope, I would recommend if your going to overclock, its a freaking breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: 2 boards DOA! Sad for how much this MOBO is.
customer_reviews.text: Showed up DOA. Tried everything I could do to make sure it was definitely the MOBO before I sent for an RMA. Well I got the second one and same exact thing. Putting all my stuff back on my ASUS Mobo and staying clear of Gigabyte mobos from now on. Rediculous
customer_reviews.author: William Smith Jr

customer_reviews.title: Super fast wifi
customer_reviews.text: One of the things that I love the most about this motherboard is that it provide super fast wifi speed.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Tran

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer shorts. Quick flash and that's it
customer_reviews.text: First one I received had a manufacturer short. The replacement had the exact same issue. Took them both to computer stores and had it confirmed. Crappy quality. You're better off with another brand
customer_reviews.author: Anna Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far.
customer_reviews.text: Love the colors and the lighting on the board goes with the ram very well
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Owen

customer_reviews.title: very nice mother board z390
customer_reviews.text: all that you need in one box, good quality, not hard to set it up
customer_reviews.author: Bronson

customer_reviews.title: dont buy this board
customer_reviews.text: dont buy this.. many people have had the same problem i had.. it does not recognize your ram properly or your cpu . move along do not buy this board. check it out on toms hardware... p o s alert
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mb for the money
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast and worked with no problems, not much else to really say. If your looking for a decent mb then go with this.
customer_reviews.author: Justin buffkin

customer_reviews.title: I love this motherboard
customer_reviews.text: the rgb on it looks really cool but the performance is amazing I paired it with the intel core i9 9900k processor and it is so fast.Plays every game flawless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When in doubt go to Gigabyte
customer_reviews.text: Had a RoG Asus motherboard that came to me broke and a ton of blue screens. Decided to go back to gigabyte for reliability and this motherboard has solidified me sticking with Gigabyte from here on out when it comes to PC building
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: What a great Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It has so many features and also looks gorgeously with its RGB. You can also buy a special CPU Waterblock (from EK), which allows you to cool CPU and VRM. I can only recommend this to you.
customer_reviews.author: P

product_meta.title: GIGABYTE Z390 AORUS ULTRA (Intel LGA1151/Z390/ATX/3xM.2 Thermal Guard/Onboard AC Wi-Fi/RGB Fusion/Gaming Motherboard)
product_meta.description: Supports 9th and 8th Intel Core processors Dual Channel Non ECC Unbuffered DDR4, 4 DIMMs integrated I/O shield Intel Octane Memory Ready 12+1 phases digital VRM solution with DrMOS advanced thermal design with direct touch heat pipe ALC1220 VB enhance 114dB(Rear)/110dB(Front) SNR in microphone with WIMA audio capacitors Intel Gigabit LAN with cFosSpeed RGB Fusion with Multi Zone LED light Show design, support addressable LED and RGB LED strips Smart Fan 5 features Multiple Temperature Sensors and Hybrid Fan Headers with FAN STOP front USB 3.1 Gen 1 Type C Header triple ultra-fast NVMe PCIe Gen3 x4 M.2 with triple thermal guards USB DAC UP 2 with Adjustable Voltage CEC 2019 Ready.305x244mm. I/O Controller - iTE I/O Controller Chip.
feature_bullets: Dual channel non ECC unbuffered DDR4, 4 DIMMs
12+1 Phases digital VRM solution with DrMOS
Advanced thermal design with direct touch heat pipe
Alc1220 vb enhance 114db(rear)/ 110db(front) SNR in microphone with WIMA audio capacitors
RGB Fusion with multi zone LED light show design, supports addressable LED & RGB LED strips

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars568 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
